intro: Oenothera scapoidea, commonly known as the slender state willow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces showy, yellow to orange flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Oenothera scapoidea is part of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its ephemeral blooming period.
